article.title: Baltimore U.S. Export Assistance Center Contact Information
article.summary: Contact the Baltimore U.S. Export Assistance Center.
article.content:
​​

​U.S. Export Assistance Center, Baltimore Office

300 West Pratt Street, Suite 300 * Baltimore MD, 21201
Tel: 410-962-4539 Fax: 410-962-4529www.export.gov/maryland

Name & Title

Industries Covered

Territory*

E-Mail

Bill Burwell

Director

General Manufacturing, Financial ServicesWashington, Allegany, GarrettBill.Burwell@t​rade.gov

Jolanta Coffey

Senior International Trade Specialist

Travel & Tourism, Environmental TechnologiesHoward, Kent, Queen Anne, Caroline, TalbotJolanta.Coffey@trade.gov

Martin Herbst

Senior International Trade Specialist

Health & Life Sciences, General Manufacturing, Export Management Companies, Financial ServicesAnne Arundel, Dorchester, Wicomico, Worcester, Somerset, Calvert, St. MaryMartin.Herbst@trade.gov

Aisha Jones

Senior International Trade Specialist

Energy, ACE, Education, & Agriculture & FoodBaltimore City, Dorchester, Wicomico, Worcester, SomersetAisha.Jones@trade.gov

Paul Matino

Senior International Trade Specialist

Aerospace and Defense, Safety & Security, Information and Communication TechnologyBaltimore, Harford, Cecil, Carroll, Charles,Paul.Matino@trade.gov
Barbara Farrar (formerly Lapini)
Commercial Officer		Montgomery, Prince George's, FrederickBarbara.Lapini@trade.gov

Bill Houck

Small Business Administration.International Finance Programs

Trade FinanceMaryland

William.Houck@sba.gov

​​202-557-4063

Trade Information Center

1-800-USA-TRADE (1-800-872-8723).The Trade Information Center works in conjunction with your local office. For immediate export assistance or for answers to your technical questions on exporting, call M-F 8:30 am - 6:00 pm Eastern time.
